explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: The substance is classified as flammable, and its powder or granules, when mixed with the air, may cause dust explosion according to ICSC (2004). Classified into Division 4.1 and Packing Group III (UN#1328) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 390degC (ICSC, 2004).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classified into Division 4.1 (UN#1328) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available, though the substance acts on aluminum, according to ICSC (2004).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 9,200mg/kg (DFGOT vol.5 (1993)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description of the human health effects (CERI Hazard Data 96-38 (1997), MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2004) and DFGOT vol.5 (1993)): "The substance slightly irritates the skin," though the results of 4 hour patch tests in rabbits suggest no evidence of irritation (DFGOT vol.5 (1993)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description of the human health effects (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2004) and DFGOT vol.5 (1993)): "The substance slightly irritates the eye," though the results of rabbit eye irritation tests suggest no irritation (DFGOT vol.5 (1993)).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Category 1 Skin sensitizer: Category 1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: Based on the description in the report on epidemiological studies (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2004) and DFGOT vol.5 (1993)): "Asthma-like symptoms were observed." Also based on the description in MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2004): "Attacks of asthma brought on." The substance is thus considered to possess a potential for respiratory sensitization. Skin sensitizer: Based on the positive results in guinea pig Maximization Tests (DFGOT vol.5 (1993)) and epidemiological evidence of skin sensitization (CERI Hazard Data 96-38 (1997), MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2004) and DFGOT vol.5 (1993)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests (dominant lethal tests) and somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (chromosome aberration tests), and the absence of data on germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, described in PATTY (4th, 2000) and DFGOT vol.5 (1993).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible based on expert judgment in the absence of existing classification, though CERI Hazard Data 96-38 (1997), PATTY (4th, 2000) and DFGOT vol.5 (1993) provide some toxicity data.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the evidence of slight increases in the number of pups stillborn or dying in early infancy though no treatment effects on body weights of parental animals were observed (no data on other endpoints are available) in teratogenicity studies with dogs, described in MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004), PATTY (4th, 2000) and DFGOT vol.5 (1993).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "acute symptoms including respiratory depression and chest tightness" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)), "cystitis, proteinuria, hematuria," "inflammation of renal tubules and renal pelvis" (CERI Hazard Data 96-38 (1997)).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Not classified from 48 hours EC50>100mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 2002).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it was not water-insolubility (the water-solubility =4.49*105mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), and acute toxicity was low, it was classified into Not classified.
